Background and Analysis:
	 
The District contracted with Geoff Kischuk of Total Compensation Systems, Inc. to prepare an Actuarial Study of Retiree Health Liabilities in compliance with Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) Statements 43 and 45.  The actuarial report is dated August 29, 2013. 
	 
Summary of General Findings:
	 
The Actuarial Accrued Liability (AAL) is $120,204,435.
The Annual Required Contribution (ARC) for 2012-13 is $9,006,774.
The pay-as-you-go cost paid by the District is estimated at $7,566,799.
The unfunded balance for 2012-13 is $1,439,975 ($9,006,774 – 7,566,799).
	 
Additional Information:
	 
Total contributions made to the irrevocable trust as of 6-30-2013 are $5,811,801.
The Fair Market Value of investments held at the California Employers’ Retiree Benefit Trust (CERBT) as of 6-30-2013 is $7,818,072.
The payment amount to the CERBT budgeted for 2013-14, based on a three-year smoothing, is $1,500,000.
	 
An additional summary will be presented on the date of the meeting.  Geoff Kischuk will conference in by phone to address the key points of the actuarial study.
	 
The OPEB Actuarial Study is presented to the Audit & Finance Committee for review and acceptance.
	 
Recommendation:  Staff recommends that the Audit & Finance committee accept the Actuarial Study dated August 29, 2013.
	 
Submitted by:
					Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor of Business Services, x6201
Additional contact names:
					Hector Quinonez, x6250
Is backup provided?
					Yes
